divs: Sighting DetailsEastern PA - standing outside BSing with neighbors after midnight - had three lights come over one after the other traveling on a heading of about 110 degrees. (NW to SE) was an orange light - looked to be moving more like a satellite than an airplane - I'm usually pretty good at IDing aircraft - this had no strobes or nav lights, just an orange glow. had one come over, a few seconds later a second - then a third.... COULD have been an iridium flare but, I've never seen three in a row.... none predicted for the time (or any other passes that are known). not moving overly fast (meteor - I've seen a bunch of those) and I'm 100% sure it wasn't an aircraft - the third one looked to "burn out" but, the shape was still easily made out in the sky for a bit....
Summary: Three orange lights moving in a direct line NE to SW over southeast PA
trends: There has been one other sighting in Drexel Hill
There were no other sightings in Drexel Hill on or around January 1st 2012
